cellularAutomata.artificialLife.fitness
Class PiFitnessFunction

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.artificialLife.fitness.PiFitnessFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
FitnessFunction
public class PiFitnessFunction
extends java.lang.Object
implements FitnessFunction

Evaluates a critter to see if it is holding a reasonable value for Pi.

Author:
David Bahr

Constructor Summary
PiFitnessFunction(double lowerBound, double upperBound)
          Create an evaluator of critters that gives highest fitness to critters with chromosomes that map to Pi.
 
Method Summary
 double evaluateFitness(Phenotype phenotype)
          Evaluates the fitness of the specified critter (phenotype) assigning the highest value to chromosomes that map to Pi.
 double getChromosomeValue(Phenotype phenotype)
          Extracts the estimation of Pi represented by the phenotype's chromosome.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

PiFitnessFunction

public PiFitnessFunction(double lowerBound,
                         double upperBound)
Create an evaluator of critters that gives highest fitness to critters with chromosomes that map to Pi.

Parameters:
lowerBound - The minimum possible value of the chromosome. Must be greater than 0.0 and less than 3.0, otherwise defaults to 0.0.
upperBound - The maximum possible value of the chromosome. Must be less than 6.0 and greater than 3.2, otherwise defaults to 6.0.
Method Detail

evaluateFitness

public double evaluateFitness(Phenotype phenotype)
Evaluates the fitness of the specified critter (phenotype) assigning the highest value to chromosomes that map to Pi.

Specified by:
evaluateFitness in interface FitnessFunction
Parameters:
phenotype - The phenotype whose fitness is being evaluated.
Returns:
The fitness of the phenotype.

getChromosomeValue

public double getChromosomeValue(Phenotype phenotype)
Extracts the estimation of Pi represented by the phenotype's chromosome.

Parameters:
phenotype - The phenotype whose fitness is being evaluated.
Returns:
The chromosome's approximation to Pi.
